Rules and recommendations

Services and similar religious gatherings may be held, but only 10 % of the seating capacity may be occupied.

You are allowed to attend a service or similar religious gathering held in your district of permanent residence only.

It is obligatory to keep a 2-meter distance from others sitting in the same line (it is not necessary to keep the distance from people sitting behind or in front of you). People living in the same household are exempt from this rule.

Upon entering the indoor premises of the church you must put on a respirator or a surgical face mask. Textile face masks or (head)scarves are not considered as a sufficient personal protection equipment anymore.

Singing together during a service is not allowed. Singers or choir members must stay in a structurally separated space or, for instance, on the quire.

During the sign of peace, it is not allowed to shake hands with each other.  

Individual spiritual service is also allowed, i.e. services, ceremonies and spiritual accompaniments, in which, in addition to the clergy only one family which shares a household participates.

Online and virtual services

Most churches offer virtual services that you can watch over the Internet or television.

The preparation of the virtual service can be attended by clergy and volunteers in such numbers as is necessary. Singing together is prohibited.

questions_answers.question: How looks the situation like in Prague?
questions_answers.value: The entire capital city of Prague is considered single district and municipality. Thus, having permanent residence in Prague 10, you are allowed to attend a service held in Prague 1.

questions_answers.question: How looks the situation like in Brno?
questions_answers.value: Both districts Brno-město (Brno city district) and Brno-venkov (Brno country district) are considered single district. Thus, having permanent residence in Šlapanice, you are allowed to attend a service held in Královo Pole borough of Brno.

questions_answers.question: How will be checked if the measures are followed? Who will check that?
questions_answers.value: Intensive spot checks will take place within the entire area of the Czech Republic. The police will use all resources available.
